title: Chamath Palihapitiya
deleted: Palihapitiya is a huge advocate of [[Tesla, Inc.|Tesla]] and green energy.

title: Chamath Palihapitiya
added: In 2021, Palihapitiya helped take Clover Health, a [[Medicare (United States)|Medicare]] insurance start-up backed by [[Alphabet Inc.]], public through a SPAC.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/06/chamath-palihapitiya-to-take-clover-health-public-in-another-spac-deal-worth-3point7-billion.html|title=Chamath Palihapitiya to take Clover Health public in another SPAC deal worth $3.7 billion|work=[[CNBC]]|first=Yun|last=Li|date=October 6, 2020|access-date=January 28, 2021}}</ref>

title: Chamath Palihapitiya
deleted: Some see{{By whom|date=January 2021}} Palihapitiya as a "stock promoter" due to his frequent appearances on TV and high volume of SPAC warrants and options.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Aliaj|first=Ortenca|date=November 13, 2020|title=The Spac sponsor bonanza|url=https://www.ft.com/content/9b481c63-f9b4-4226-a639-238f9fae4dfc|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=|website=Financial Times}}</ref>

title: Chamath Palihapitiya
deleted: In early 2021, during the [[GameStop short squeeze]], he repeatedly attacked [[Robinhood (company)|Robinhood]] and its founders for being unethical by selling payment for order flow to HFT firms like [[Citadel LLC|Citadel Securities]] and pushed his fans to switch over to [[SoFi]], which was merging with his SPAC.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|last=Tysdon|first=Brody|date=Jan 31, 2021|title=So Chamath has been making a lot of noise attacking Robinhood and implying there's a conspiracy because it sells retail transaction data (payment for order flow) to Ken Griffin's Citadel.|url=https://twitter.com/tysonbrody/status/1355967493089669131|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=|website=}}</ref> Many pointed out that [[SoFi]] employs that same practice of selling payment for order flow (including to Citadel Securities)<ref>{{Cite web|last=Detrixhe|first=John|title=Fintech firms like SoFi and Robinhood offer “free” stock trading. What’s the catch?|url=https://qz.com/1560010/is-sofi-invests-brokerage-service-really-free/|access-date=2021-01-31|website=Quartz|language=en}}</ref> and that [[SoFi]] owns a 16% stake in Apex Clearing Corp, the clearing house at the center of the [[Robinhood (company)|Robinhood]] controversy.<ref name=":0" /><ref>{{Cite news|last=McCabe|first=Caitlin|date=2021-01-28|title=GameStop Trading Restrictions Blamed on Wall Street’s Clearing Firm by Online Broker|language=en-US|work=Wall Street Journal|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/gamestop-trading-restrictions-blamed-on-wall-streets-clearing-firm-by-online-broker-11611867105|access-date=2021-01-31|issn=0099-9660}}</ref>
